meanings.definition: In a way that can be exchanged or substituted for one another
meanings.sent1: She used the blue and red crayons interchangeably to color the picture.
meanings.sent2: The twins dressed almost interchangeably, making it hard to tell them apart.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled rabbits out of his hat interchangeably, confusing the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her moods changed interchangeably like the weather in spring.
meanings.sent5: The keys to the lock were interchangeable, fitting any of the doors perfectly.

meanings.definition: Using two or more things in a way that each can be used instead of the other
meanings.sent1: The interchangeable parts of the toy made it easy to repair.
meanings.sent2: The interchangeable seats in the auditorium allowed for flexible seating arrangements.
meanings.sent3: The interchangeable puzzle pieces made it challenging to complete the picture.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like interchangeable gears, always working together smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The interchangeable tools in the toolbox made every task seem effortless.
